content: antonio s spring cappellino the four seasons collection begins with spring it is widely believed that antonio vivaldi s inspiration for the four seasons stems from the time he spent as the court chapel master in the gorgeous countryside of mantua italy like its companion vivaldi spring mitts this sweet cappellino is a tangle of leaves and tender shoots reaching for the sun with buds ready to burst forth in a celebration of the season please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 size fits an average teen/adult head 20-24 inches/50-60 cm gauge 6 stitches per inch on us 4 in stockinette in the round *see blocking notes materials dk/light worsted yarn 150 -200 yards us 4 3 5mm circular needle or double point needles **optional fuzzy lace yarn 35 yards notions 10 stitch markers 1 unique stitch marker and a tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop k2tog - knit 2 together kfbf - knit into the front and back and front of the same stitch mb - make bobble *** p - purl pm - place marker rm remove marker s sm - slip marker s gracianne designs ssk - slip 1 knitwise slip 1 knitwise knit slipped stitches together through the back loop sts - stitches yo - yarn over *** cocoknits has a great tutorial for knitting 3 stitch bobbles without turning your work easy-peasy https //cocoknits com/blogs/knit-tutorials/how-to-knit-bobbles-without-turning-your-work this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 cast on 106 stitches using a stretchy cast on method place a unique stitch marker and prepare to join and work in the round twisted ribbing k1tbl p1 for 12 rounds set up round k3 ssk k to end of round 105 stitches lace pattern rounds 1 37 knit boxed section 6 times before knitting the final repeat on each round using a stitch marker between repeats makes the lace simple and faster to knit **optional to tint the buds carry a strand of fuzzy lace weight yarn along with the main color for rounds 33 35 37 trapping floats as necessary crown decreases round 1 k10 k2tog k19 k2tog 4x k9 removing markers 100 stitches round 2 k8 k2tog pm repeat to end of round 90 stitches round 3 k to end of round sm round 4 k7 k2tog sm repeat to end of round 80 stitches round 5 k to end of round sm round 6 k6 k2tog sm repeat to end of round 70 stitches round 7 k to end of round sm round 8 k5 k2tog sm repeat to end of round 60 stitches round 9 k to end of round sm round10 k4 k2tog sm repeat to end of round 50 stitches
